definition: to round up to the nearest integer/to discard four, but treat five as whole (of decimal points)
to give up/to abandon/to give alms
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: The figures in the table are rounded to the nearest ton.
sentences.chinese: 表中的數字四捨五入到最接近的整噸數。

sentences.english: The dutiable value shall be rounded off to RMB fen.
sentences.chinese: 完稅價格採用四捨五入法計算至分。

sentences.english: Round each measurement to the nearest whole inch or centimetre.
sentences.chinese: 將每個測量數目四捨五入到最近的英寸或釐米整數。

sentences.english: All figures should be rounded down to the nearest penny.
sentences.chinese: 所有數字應四捨五入到最接近的一分錢。

sentences.english: Then see which ten a number is closer to.
sentences.chinese: 然後再看哪一個十位數最接近你要四捨五入的數字。

sentences.english: If the one'sdigitis less than 5, round to thelesserten.
sentences.chinese: 如果數字低於5，則四捨五入到較小的十位數。

sentences.english: Rounding it off to the nearest whole number gives you two.
sentences.chinese: 四捨五入到最接近的整數是2。

definition: the cap of a pen, pencil or writing brush/the sheath of a pen (made of cloth, silk or thread)
(math.) the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter (π)
problem or question solved for illustrative purposes in the classroom/practice question (used in preparation for an exam)/sample question
summary/to summarize/to collect (data, receipts etc)/to gather and report/also written 匯總|汇总
postulate (math.)/public facilities (abbr. for 公共設施|公共设施[gong1 gong4 she4 shi1])
remainder (after rounding a number)/decimal part (of number after the decimal point)/mantissa (i.e. fractional part of common logarithm in math.)/small change/balance (of an account)

pinyin: shen1 ti3 zhi4 liang4 zhi3 shu4
